intro: Plectritis ciliosa var. insignis, commonly known as the woolly goldenweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. Its botanical features make it well adapted to arid environments and contribute to its ecological significance in native plant communities.
